IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
To run
pomeni hitro se premikati, pri čemer se ob vsakem premiku naša noga oddalji od tal.

seg.quote: I ran downstairs to open the door.
He ran the mile in just over four minutes.

sense.def:
To have a run
pomeni teči.

seg.quote: We had to go for a cross-country run every weekend.
He found himself breaking into a run.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj daljšega, na primer cesta,
runs in a particular direction
, poteka v določeni smeri ali vodi v določeno smer.

seg.quote: The reef runs parallel to the coast.

sense.def:
To run an object or one's hand over something
pomeni premakniti predmet ali roko prek nečesa.

seg.quote: She ran her finger down a list of names.

sense.def:
To run in an election
pomeni sodelovati v volitvah kot kandidat;

seg.quote: He ran for Governor.

sense.def:
To run an organization or an activity
pomeni biti odgovoren za delovanje organizacije ali ustanove ali jo organizirati.

seg.quote: She ran the office as a captain runs a ship.
We run a course for local teachers.

sense.def:
To run an experiment, computer program, or tape
pomeni narediti preskus, pognati računalniški program ali magnetofonski ali video posnetek in pustiti, da teče.

seg.quote: Check everything and run the whole test again.

sense.def:
To run a car or piece of equipment
pomeni imeti avto ali opremo in jo uporabljati.

seg.quote: A freezer doesn't cost much to run.

sense.def:
Kadar stroj
is running
, je vključen in opravlja svojo funkcijo.

seg.quote: The engine was running.

sense.def:
To run a machine on or off a particular source of energy
pomeni, da stroj ali napravo uporabljamo tako, da je ali ni priključena na določen vir energije.

seg.quote: You can run the entire system off a mains plug.
The heater ran on half-price electricity.

sense.def:
Kadar vlak ali avtobus
runs somewhere
, vozi po stalni progi ob stalnem urniku.

seg.quote: No buses have been running in the town for the past week.

sense.def:
To run someone somewhere
pomeni nekoga nekam peljati, na primer z avtom.

seg.quote: Would you mind running me to the station?

sense.def:
Kadar tekočina
runs in a particular direction
, se premika v določeno smer.

seg.quote: Tears were running down his face.
The river ran past our house.

sense.def:
To run water
ali
to run a tap
pomeni, da odpremo pipo, tako da iz nje priteče voda.

seg.quote: She was running hot water into the tub.
Run my bath now!

sense.def:
Kadar barva nekega oblačila
runs
, se pri pranju izpere v vodo.

Kadar igra, dogodek ali pogodba
runs for a particular period of time
, traja določen čas.

seg.quote: ‘Chu-Chin-Chow’ ran for years.
The monsoons had six weeks more to run.

sense.def:
A run
je v gledališču obdobje, v katerem je določena predstava na programu.

seg.quote: The play ended its six-week run at the Regent.

sense.def:
A run of success or failure
je nepretrgan niz uspehov ali neuspehov.

seg.quote: Leeds United had a run of wins in December.

sense.def:
A run
je pri kriketu ali baseballu točka, ki jo igralci dosežejo, ko pretečejo razdaljo med označenimi deli igrišča, potem ko udarijo žogo.

seg.quote: They had beaten England by seventeen runs.

sense.def:
Kdor je
on the run
, poskuša pobegniti ali se skriti, na primer pred policijo ali sovražnikom.

To make a run for it
ali
to run for it
pomeni nekam steči, da bi se izognili čemu.

seg.quote: It was still raining hard, but we made a run for it.
We'll just have to run for it.

sense.def:
Ko govorimo o stvareh, ki se bodo zgodile
in the long run
, gre za stvari, ki se bodo po našem dogajale dalj časa v prihodnosti. Ko pa govorimo o stvareh, ki se bodo zgodile
in the short run
, gre za stvari, ki se bodo po našem dogajale v bližnji prihodnosti.

cit.quote: dolgoročno, na dolgi rok; kratkoročno, na kratki rok

seg.quote: Their policy would prove very costly in the long run.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
is running late
, je potrebovalo več časa, kot pa je bilo prvotno za tisto načrtovano.

Kadar reka ali vodnjak
runs dry
, ostane brez vode.

Kadar čustva ljudi
are running high
, se ljudje razvnamejo, tako da so zelo jezni, zaskrbljeni ali razburjeni.

seg.quote: Public indignation was running high.

sense.def:
To run across someone
pomeni nepričakovano srečati nekoga.

To run away from a place
pomeni oditi od nekod, ker se tam ne počutimo dobro.

seg.quote: He had run away from home at the age of thirteen.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo pusti, da čustva
run away with oneself
, jim dovoli, da ga prevzamejo.

seg.quote: They did not allow their enthusiasm to run away with them.

sense.def:
To run down people or things
pomeni nekoga ali nekaj ostro kritizirati.

seg.quote: She was not used to people running down their own families.

sense.def:
To run into problems or difficulties
pomeni, da začnemo nepričakovano doživljati težave ali zaplete.

seg.quote: The firm ran into foreign exchange problems.

sense.def:
To run into someone
pomeni tisto osebo nepričakovano srečati.

Kadar vozilo
runs into something
, po nesreči udari ob nekaj.

To run into
pomeni stati določen znesek denarja.

seg.quote: ...exports running into billions of dollars.

sense.def:
To run off with someone
pomeni skrivaj oditi z določeno osebo, s katero potem živimo ali se poročimo.

seg.quote: His wife ran off with another man.

sense.def:
To run off copies of a piece of writing
pomeni, da na stroj naredimo večje število kopij besedila.

To run out of something
pomeni, da tistega nimamo več. Kadar nekaj
runs out
, tistega ni več.

seg.quote: We were rapidly running out of money.
Time is running out fast.

sense.def:
Kadar uradni dokument
runs out
, neha biti veljaven.

seg.quote: My passport's run out.

sense.def:
Kadar vozilo
runs over someone or something
, zadene osebo ali stvar, tako da ta pade po tleh.

seg.quote: Rosamund nearly got run over last night.

sense.def:
To run through something
pomeni vaditi nekaj, da bomo sposobni tisto izvesti brez napak.

seg.quote: You could hear the performers running through the whole programme in the background.

sense.def:
To run through a list of items
pomeni na hitro prebrati ali navesti vse, kar je napisano na seznamu.

To run up bills or debts
pomeni dobiti račune ali se zadolžiti, ker veliko kupujemo ali ker si izposojamo denar.

To run up against problems
pomeni, da naenkrat začnemo doživljati težave.
